page.title: 12Facilities in N.E.Mynd Area
page.content: Services that are taken for granted by town dwellers are sometimes non- existent in the country areas. There are no schools here and child- ren have to travel by bus provided by the local authority.This applies to both primary and secondary schools. Public transport is available along the A49.As this is only at two-hourly intervals between morning and early evening,even shopping can be a major problem. The W.R.V.S. provide a welcome service to the elderly but all medical services are provided by the Health Centre in Church Stretton.All mail is delivered once daily. There are no cinemas,theatres or any other public entertainment centres.All social activities are provided by the villagers themselves.
